poem:
### Cold Dawn

Clouds of rusted iron swell
in the bloodshot east.
Long echoes stir, machine
rattles in the marrow;
new dawn, old frost.
Men, puppets of shadow,
carve lines in the sky –
history's cold breath
condenses into steel.
And still, the earth sighs
under weight of words,
the chill of promises
kept in dark pockets.
